message: I'm not aware of a one time credit card but I know Walmart sells a "green dot" card that you can charge up and use like a credit card

I know it's not technically a 'tech' question, but I'm sure it's near and dear to our hearts. I would like to find a service for creating one-shot credit cards for sites I want to buy from but don't fully trust. Is there still a service out there that'll do that?
Not quite what I'm looking for; I want something that I can use once and then never worry about again.
Some credit card companies will do this for you. Ask your provider
Can you name some? I'm new to the US, so I have a window in which I can choose a new provider.
I use a debit card as a burner. put $20 and made sure I can't overdraft
@offby1 they have these Vannilla Visa Cards from Rite Aid 4.95 plus what ever size U want what I use alot
Citibank has been issuing one time use numbers for years
I've been using Citibank's single use numbers for years.
you guys are lucky ... no such option in my country
